news.title: Six Makorokoza Die In Flooded Mine Shaft
news.content:
By A Correspondent-Six miners have died after an underground shaft at Golden Reef Mine in Etina, Eiffel Flats, Kadoma, suddenly flooded.

The Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP) has confirmed the death of the six and released their names.

The victims, all identified by their next of kin, are: Jacob Maposa (plot 31, Umbark, Kadoma), Colleen Sibanda (plot 31, Umbark), Nevers Makarichi (plot 21, Umbark), Simbarashe Bangira (plot 42, Umbark), Danai Mashoko (plot 42, Umbark), and Givemore Chiredzi (Maratonga Village, Kadoma).

In a statement on the ZRP spokesperson, Commissioner Paul Nyathi, urged miners to strictly follow the countrys mining safety regulations to prevent such tragedies.

He stressed that miners should avoid entering shafts known to be prone to flooding, particularly during and after rainfall.

news.title: Examining Emmerson Mnangagwa’s Plot To Bury Constantino Chiwenga
news.content:
By Brighton MutebukaHuman Rights Lawyer and Political Commentator

We are revisiting the political chessboard once again to assess what EDs likely end game is vis--vis the ZANU PF power succession matrix in light of General P.V. Sibandas retirement from Zimbabwes military.

ED currently has two challenges:

Tagwireyi is a nonentity, a political upstart who is deeply reviled, highly unpopular & vulnerable to being swept aside at any moment by an angry tide in ZANU PF.

He will always require political scaffolding to maintain his position. He would be turned into mince meat in any direct duel with Chiwenga.

That is where Sibanda likely comes in. His combined liberation struggle & military credentials & perceived level headedness are likely to be laundered & weaponised by ED to bury Chiwenga politically at some point further down the road.

With Tapfumaneyi destined to be CDF after his stint at FAZ, such a combined team on the political & military front would present formidable obstacles to any potential Chiwenga insurgency.

It would be a decidedly pro-ED team guaranteed to deliver loyalty while also shielding him from charges of trying to create a family dynasty at the heart of Zimbabwean politics.

Outwardly at least, especially to the gullible, it would create a veneer of the continuation of the current military backed politics if the situation unfolds in that fashion.

Fierce speculation currently places @ProfJNMoyo at the centre of ZANU PF power succession matrix political intrigue.

news.title: ED Mortgages Another Hotel to the Arabs
news.content:
By Business Reporter  President Emmerson Mnangagwa has mortgaged another hotel to the Arabs.

Victoria Falls most spectacular hospitality landmark, the Kingdom Hotel, has been sold to a United Arab Emirates (UAE) investor in a move that further deepens the Gulf states growing footprint in Zimbabwes economy  a trend long linked to President Emmerson Mnangagwas quiet but extensive business ties with the UAE.

This development comes against the backdrop of years of clandestine commercial dealings between Zimbabwean elites and UAE-linked companies, particularly in gold and diamonds. Investigations by international watchdogs have repeatedly highlighted how millions of dollars worth of Zimbabwean gold is flown to Dubai annually through opaque networks, with limited transparency on remittances to the national treasury.

Mnangagwa himself has long cultivated close relations with UAE business interests. Since taking power in 2017, he has frequently relied on privately chartered planes from the UAE for international travel  an arrangement that has raised questions about the extent of his personal and political ties to Gulf financiers. Critics argue that these relationships have opened the door for UAE entities to secure strategic economic assets in Zimbabwe through preferential access.

The latest transaction strengthens that pattern.

Victoria Falls Stock Exchange-listed First Capital Bank has signed a binding share purchase agreement with UAE-based ASB Hospitality LLC for its 50 percent shareholding in hotel operator Makasa Sun (Pvt) Limited, the company that owns the former Kingdom Hotel.

This acquisition marks ASBs second major takeover of a top Zimbabwean hotel asset. In 2019, the Emirati investor acquired the iconic Meikles Hotel in Harare, which has since been rebranded as theHyatt Regency Harare  The Meiklesafter a multi-million-dollar redevelopment.

The Kingdom Hotel  later renamedMakasa Sun Hotel closed in early 2023 following a lease dispute with previous operator Africa Sun Limited. Highly popular for its proximity to the Victoria Falls rainforest and its distinctive architectural style inspired by Great Zimbabwe, the hotel was one of the resort citys signature properties.

Once the sale is finalised, ASB Hospitality is expected to rebrand and reopen the landmark.

First Capital Bank confirmed that it and the First Capital Bank Staff Pension Fund have agreed to sell100 percentof the issued ordinary and preference shares in Makasa Sun to ASB Hospitality forUS$30 million.

A deposit ofUS$3 millionhas already been placed in escrow, with the remainingUS$27 millionpayable upon completion.

According to First Capital Bank company secretarySarudzai Binha, Makasa Suns consolidated net asset value stood atUS$27.98 million as at 31 October 2024, making the purchase price broadly aligned with the hotels book value.

Ms Binha said the disposal allows the bank to refocus on core financial services while unlocking value from a dormant hospitality asset.

ASB Hospitalitys expansion comes as Zimbabwes tourism sector rebounds strongly, buoyed by government incentives, special economic zones in Victoria Falls, and increased international arrivals.

But the sale also reinforces concerns that high-value national assets  especially in mining and tourism  are increasingly falling under the influence of UAE-linked entities amid Mnangagwas deepening political and commercial relations with Dubai.

Opposition figures and analysts argue that these transactions reflect a broader pattern in which Zimbabwes leadership leverages secrecy-laden foreign networks in the UAE for political financing, international travel arrangements, and the movement of gold, diamonds, and other precious resources.

With First Capital Banks market capitalisation standing atUS$134 millionon 17 September 2025  the date of the first cautionary statement  the banks 50 percent stake in Makasa Sun, valued atUS$15 million, represents11.19 percentof its market value. Under VFEX rules, the deal qualifies as a category three transaction, and the bank has said it will comply with all required disclosures.

Proceeds from the sale will go toward settling statutory capital gains tax, distributing returns to shareholders, and reinvesting in the banks core operations and pension fund obligations.

news.title: Leaked WhatsApp Chat Reveals Child In Viral Abuse Video Was Beaten By Stepmother
news.content:
By Farai D Hove | Fresh details have emerged in the case of the disturbing child-abuse video that shocked the nation this week, after a leaked WhatsApp chat circulating online revealed that the woman seen violently assaulting the tied-up child is allegedly the stepmother  not the biological mother.

According to the leaked messages, said to originate from community members in Bocha, under Chief Muchisi, the woman was reportedly arrested after neighbours identified her. The circulating message claims the child had taken a piece of bread from a neighbour, prompting the brutal beating captured in the video.

The chat further alleges that the biological mother is no longer living with the child, and that the stepmother was left in charge. One message reads in part:

PaBocha mubhuku ra Muchisi watosungwa mai awa mwana atora chingwa cheumwe akudya. Hawasi mai wake, ndimai inini mai wake vakaenda. Ngatidzidzei kunzwira vana tsitsi.

Translated, it states: This happened in Bocha, under Chief Muchisi. The woman has been arrested. The child had taken someones bread. She is not the childs real mother  the real mother is no longer there. Let us learn to have compassion for children.

The message also reflects deep community anger, with residents calling the assault heartbreaking and urging adults to protect children, even in cases of marital conflict or separation.

Police Investigations Continue

The Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP) earlier confirmed that investigations are underway to identify all individuals involved and ensure the child receives protection and medical attention.

Authorities have not yet confirmed the leaked WhatsApp details, but police sources indicate that the information is being reviewed as part of the ongoing investigation.

Social welfare officials are also expected to intervene as more information emerges about the childs living arrangements and safety.

This is a developing story, and ZimEye will provide further verified updates as they come.

news.title: Early Warning Signs: How a Fake Employer Lured a Masvingo Mother Into a Child Kidnapping Trap
news.content:
Masvingo  The shocking disappearance of a four-month-old baby after a stranger posing as an employer vanished with the child has raised new urgency for communities to learn the early warning signs of child-snatching trickery now spreading across Zimbabwe.

Nineteen-year-old Letwin Ngandini had been offered what appeared to be a simple cleaning job. Instead, the encounter ended with her child being taken by the same woman who claimed she needed help at her unfinished house.

Police say the incident happened on November 13 along Sweetview Road, and they are now treating the case as kidnapping.

But beyond the investigation lies a pressing community question:How can ordinary people spot these dangers before they happen?

How the Kidnapper Struck  And the Warning Signs Many Missed

According to police reports, the suspect approached Ngandini with a friendly demeanour and a believable story: the house was under construction, she needed help cleaning, and she would pay for the work.

The two walked nearly 500 metres to a half-built structure  a location isolated enough to give the kidnapper control.

Once there, the suspect instructed Ngandini to fetch a shovel.And when she returned 30 minutes later, both her baby and the woman had vanished.

This case demonstrates key danger signals that communities must learn to recognise  signals that are often ignored because the encounter feels normal or friendly.

To assist families, child-protection advocates and police recommend a simple checklist called the Early Warning Signs of a Kidnap Setup.

 EARLY WARNING SIGNS OF A CHILD-SNATCHING SETUP

Below are the danger signs that Ngandinis case reveals  signs that could protect another family tomorrow.

1. A stranger offering work immediately, with urgency

Kidnappers often push victims to act fast so they do not have time to think or consult anyone.

2. A request to go to a remote or half-built location

Unfinished houses, bushy areas and construction sites are now commonly used because no one else is around.

3. The suspect insists on going now, without allowing the victim to bring someone

A real employer will never object to an escort, especially for casual labour.

4. The stranger tries to create a false sense of comfort

Conversations, jokes, friendliness or offering money for snacks are manipulation tools used to lower defence.

5. The suspect asks the parent to leave the child behind just for a minute

This is the moment the kidnapping usually happens.

6. No identifiable employer details

No phone number, no ID, no location written down, no other workers on site  nothing that links the employer to a real address.

7. A shift in the suspects behaviour when you ask questions

Evading questions, insisting on silence, or brushing off safety concerns is a red flag.

Police Urge Communities to Self-Protect

Masvingo Provincial Police Spokesperson Inspector Kudakwashe Dhewa urged residents:

Anyone with information leading to the suspects identification should contact any nearest police station or ZRP Masvingo Province WhatsApp: 0775 996 945.

He added that communities should educate job seekers and parents on these early warning signs, as economic hardship is increasingly being exploited by predators.

A Pattern of Manipulation

This is not the first such incident.

In September 2024, a Chiredzi woman temporarily left her baby with a stranger who had befriended her outside a hospital. The woman disappeared  using nearly identical tactics: friendliness, money, and sudden trust.

That child was later found. The Masvingo baby is still missing.

Community Responsibility Is Now Key

The Masvingo case proves one painful truth:Kidnappers no longer snatch children by force  they do it by pretending to be helpers.

As economic challenges deepen, more people may fall victim to such predators unless communities:share this information widelywarn young mothersaccompany job seekersquestion suspicious job offersreport suspicious movements immediately

Because in moments like these, awareness is the strongest defence families have left.

news.title: Questions Over ZBC-Endorsed Aircraft for Beitbridge–Harare Route
news.content:
By Dorrothy Moyo | Questions are mounting over the suitability of the small aircraft unveiled by ZBC as the new passenger service for the BeitbridgeHarare route, after aviation experts noted that the plane seats only six to eight passengers, far below the capacity expected for a commercial public service.

The aircraft, identified as a Cessna-type light commuter plane, is typically used for charter operations, medical evacuation, or short-range rural hops  not scheduled airline services. This has raised concerns about safety standards, economic viability, and whether the launch was prematurely celebrated without meeting the basic thresholds of a commercial passenger operation.

The plane in the picture is almost certainly a Cessna 404 Titan, an American-made twin-engine, unpressurised light transport aircraft.Key identifying features visible in your image: Long nose Twin piston engines mounted under the wings Rectangular cabin windows (usually 67) High-set horizontal stabiliser Squared-off tail with a dark stripe

These match the Cessna 404 Titan very closely.

 How old is it?

The Cessna 404 was produced between 1976 and 1982.That means any surviving aircraft today is:

43  49 years old.

 Passenger Capacity

The Cessna 404 was designed as a commuter and cargo aircraft.Its typical seating: Pilot(s): 1 or 2 Passengers: up to 10 (but often 68 depending on configuration)

Some versions are used purely for cargo.

 Safety Record

Overall, the Cessna 404 has a moderate safety record for a light twin-engine piston aircraft. Factors affecting incidents include: Engine failures (common in older piston twins) Pilot error Overloading (frequent in commercial operations in Africa and Latin America) Poor maintenance on older airframes Weather-related crashes (IFR capability is limited)

It is not considered unsafe, but safety depends heavily on:1. The operator,2. The engines condition, and3. Maintenance quality.

Well-maintained examples fly safely worldwide.

 Range Before Refuelling

The Cessna 404 Titan has: Maximum range: ~1,3501,600 km (730860 nautical miles) Typical safe operational range: 9001,200 km

This varies depending on: Weight Weather/winds Fuel tank configuration Power settings

 Summary

Feature DetailAircraft type Cessna 404 TitanYears produced 19761982Age today 4349 yearsPassenger capacity Up to 10 (usually 68)Range 1,3501,600 kmSafety record Moderate; highly dependent on maintenance & operator

news.content:
Tinashe Sambiri  The widow of the late Nkulumane MP, Desire Moyo, Ester Zitha, has successfully filed her nomination papers as an independent candidate during the Nomination Court session held at Tradegold Magistrates Court in Bulawayo on Thursday. She will contest in the Nkulumane Parliamentary by-election scheduled for 20 December 2025, seeking to replace her late husband.

news.title: Horror As Man Consumes Poison After Axing Wife To Death
news.content:
Tinashe Sambiri  A man from Birchenough Bridge is reported to have fatally attacked his wife before later taking his own life, police have confirmed.

Acting Manicaland Provincial Police Spokesperson, Assistant Inspector Wiseman Chinyoka, said the tragic incident occurred last Tuesday at Gadzai Village in the early hours of the morning.

The incident happened around 2 AM after the couple had retired to bed earlier that night, he said.

According to police, Luckson Muchadei (42) had visited his estranged wife, Prisca Mabuyazve (33), around 8 PM. The two were staying at the homestead of John Dube in Gadzai Village.

Assistant Inspector Chinyoka said Muchadei allegedly woke up during the night and carried out the fatal attack while his wife was asleep. The victim died on the spot, he said.

After the incident, Muchadei left the homestead and was later found in a nearby bushy area, where he had consumed a poisonous substance. He was located by a 13-year-old boy who quickly informed the police, Chinyoka said.

Mabuyazves body was discovered around 6 AM by Simbarashe Nemadire, who had gone to the homestead to collect a debt. He alerted neighbours, and a report was made to the police.

Muchadei was taken to Birchenough Bridge Hospital after being found, but he unfortunately passed away while receiving treatment, Chinyoka confirmed.

Police urged communities to seek peaceful ways of resolving domestic disputes

news.title: Health Ministry Probes Fake Nursing Recruitment Website, Social Media Scams
news.content:
By A Correspondent  The Ministry of Health and Child Care has launched investigations into a fake nursing recruitment website and a rising number of social media scams targeting aspiring nursing applicants.

In a statement yesterday, the ministrys spokesperson, Mr Donald Mujiri, said fraudsters were exploiting WhatsApp groups, social media platforms and private cellphone numbers to deceive desperate applicants into believing they could secure nursing school placements through unofficial channels.

He emphasised that legitimate recruitment isonlyannounced through the countrys mainstream print media and the ministrys verified social media pages. Mr Mujiri warned that anything outside these platforms is fake, illegal and aimed at stealing money from the public.

We are working with law enforcement to track, arrest and prosecute all individuals involved in these scams, he said. Corruption, bribery and backdoor recruitment will not be tolerated. The public is advised not to pay anyone, join unofficial groups, or respond to private phone numbers claiming to assist with nursing entry or job placement.

Nurse training in Zimbabwe remains one of the most competitive programmes, attracting thousands of applicants for limited training places each year.

To improve fairness and transparency, the ministry recently decentralised the recruitment process, allowing local applicants to benefit directly. However, the high number of applicants has also created opportunities for manipulation and corruption by scammers.
